title: Disable Logs
body:
### Description of the bug:


How can I disable the display of logs on the screen? I want a clean interface so I can easily view my conversations.

### Actual vs expected behavior:


_No response_

### Any other information you'd like to share?


_No response_
author: saliksik

comments.body: Hello! if clicking the icon to minimize the log to the left isn't enough then you can fully remove it very easily. Just  go in to `src/App.tsx` and delete the line with `<SidePanel/>`

title: Last audio chunks are repeated twice.
body:
### Description of the bug:


To replicate the bug, simply type "hi". The model will respond "Hello, how can I help you today?" and then "you today" after. It mostly happens at the start of the session but I noticed it happening in the middle too. 

There seems to be an issue of how the audio chunks are being processed. 
If you ask something like "How are you?" and the model responds with longer output thanking me, asking me, etc, (ie. threre are longer audio chunks) then it works fine. 

### Actual vs expected behavior:


_No response_

### Any other information you'd like to share?


_No response_
author: ViaAnthroposBenevolentia

comments.body: Any update on this?
Have the same issue here.

> Any update on this?

So the issue is either in how the incoming audio bytes are processed. Like maybe when the audio size is x size then the chunk is repeated twice.

But I doubt this. Cause if you ask the model to say "Hi, how can I help you today?" then it repeats it perfectly (and can many times) without the annoying "you today?" repetition. 

That leads to the only conclusion that it is a server issue. I guess we'll have to wait until the model will no longer be under "exp" label and Google will release the polished model.

That makes sense. I was considering doing it the traditional way, using Deepgram and Azure, but if the non-experimental version of Gemini 2.0 is released soon, it might end up being a wasted effort this is released with fixes. When do you think it will be released, any idea?

> When do you think it will be released, any idea?

I guess in a "few weeks" haha. They said that on Twitter like a week (or two?) ago.

As for the temporary fix, well maybe add an if statement to check if it is a first response and if the message is "Hi, how can I help you today?" then if the bytes are longer than expected cut the end? Yeah I think something like that could be made. Or use speech to text models (by sacrificing speed) to first convert the model's output to text and check for repeating the last words.
Yes but there's also one thing i wanted to ask, were you able to input system instructions? It doesn't work either for me.
It's in the Altair.tsx in components folder
Facing the same issue here as well would be great to get this fixed. Love the Gemini model even compared to GPT-Realtime
@naveengovind @Hemanth-TS @herrkaefer I think this got fixed? I no longer get such buggy responses when I type 'hi'. The model seems to improved.

Oh? In the same experimental model? Thatâ€™s great! I kind of dropped it after a while. I had set it up with Deepgram for transcription and everything, but the function calling seems to be bugged. Gemini calls a function to reference a knowledge base (Iâ€™ve set up an API), and while it does fetch the contents correctly, Gemini doesnâ€™t seem to actually refer to it at all.

Yes, in the same model.
About the function calling, have you sent the tool response back to it?

Yeah, i tried everything almost, the model just seemed to ignore that set of information from the function call. There was someone facing similar issue in the google ai developer forum. I didn't spend much time on it as it is just an experimental model anyway.

title: Simple typo:  isServerContenteMessage should be isServerContentMessage (no "e" after Content)
body:
### Description of the bug:


Basic typo in multimodal-live-types.ts:

author: Phodaie

comments.body: thank you!

title: Is there a way to determine if Gemini has finished speaking in text or audio?
author: Mr-LiuDC

comments.body: The model will respond with `turnComplete` which can also be listened to with `client.on('turncomplete', listener)`

title: Getting text responses ðŸ’¯
body:
### Description of the feature request:


Dear Development Team,

First, I want to express my sincere gratitude for sharing the code and making it accessible to the community. Your work is impressive, and itâ€™s evident how much thought and effort has gone into creating this solution.

Iâ€™m currently tinkering with your app, and it has been a fantastic experience so far. However, Iâ€™m looking to enhance it further by adding support for text responses, aiming to make it a more comprehensive, all-in-one solution.

I would be incredibly grateful for your advice or guidance on the best way to approach this. If you have any recommendations, documentation, or examples that could help, Iâ€™d be more than happy to learn from them or you :)

Thank you once again for your generosity in sharing this code and for any help you can offer. I deeply appreciate your time and expertise.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

### What problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


_No response_

### Any other information you'd like to share?


_No response_
author: deVirtuoso

comments.body: there is a line in the config `responseModalities: "audio"` if you change that to `responseModalities: "text"` you will get all outputs in text instead of audio. There is currently no way to get outputs in both audio and text so you must choose one or the other before connecting to your session.
Thanks for taking the time--much appreciated!

title: Problem using the multimodal-live-api-web-console, GenExprorer example
body:
### Description of the bug:


When I start the app all works well but it says 
13:51server.errorCould not connect to "wss://autopush-generativelanguage.googleapis.com/ws/google.ai.generativelanguage.v1alpha.GenerativeService.BidiGenerateContent?key=XXXXXXX"

Note I have set the api key


### Actual vs expected behavior:


_No response_

### Any other information you'd like to share?


_No response_
author: oscarcalvo

comments.body:
In App.tsx if you remove `autopush-` from the host URL, that should fix it.

ex: `const host = "generativelanguage.googleapis.com";`
you are right @machina-source, I have seen your PR. thanks a lot
